name: Ablative Plate
imageDescription: A large parabolic ablative plate with shock absorbers for nuclear pulse propulsion.

name: Ablative Nozzle
imageDescription: A hemispherical nozzle with silicon carbide liner.

imageDescription: A convergent-divergent rocket nozzle for supersonic expansion.

imageDescription: Superconducting YBCO coils create magnetic fields containing hot plasmas.

name: Dumbo
imageDescription: A folded-flow nuclear reactor with hydrogen coolant.

name: Timberwind
imageDescription: A spun reactor forming a fluidized bed of fuel grains.

imageDescription: 300 electrostatic thrusters with magnetic coils.

name: Ion Drive
imageDescription: 361 electrostatic thrusters with microwave antenna.

name: Mass Driver
imageDescription: A 390m railgun launching buckets of dirt.

name: MPD T-wave
imageDescription: Electromagnetic pulses eject propellant entrained by superfluid 3He plasma.

imageDescription: Solid ferromagnetic metastable helium storing 480 MJ/kg.

name: n-6Li Microfission
imageDescription: Exotic initiators permit propulsion by tiny nuclear bombs.

name: Monatomic Plug Nozzle
imageDescription: Plug nozzle maximizing recombination of monatomic hydrogen.

name: Vortex Confined Nozzle
imageDescription: A reactor running hot enough to vaporize the core, spun in a vortex.

ability: DeCom. Immune to Flare & Belt Rolls.

name: Electric Sail

imageDescription: A 1 km spinning disk sail with superconducting magnetic loop.

imageDescription: Ion drive with 4 grids for extraction and acceleration.
